reviews.text: The smartphone market in 2026 is no longer about just raw megapixels or clock speeds; it’s about how seamlessly a device integrates into your life through intelligence. The Nova Ultra 7 enters the fray not just as a piece of hardware, but as a dedicated AI companion. After two weeks of heavy use, here is our deep dive
this phone is good

The OnePlus 15R feels really smooth and great to use. Looks great went with mint breeze. As a gamer, the performance stays solid even over long sessions, and it doesn’t heat up much. It runs heavy games like Genshin Impact, Wuthering Waves, Where Winds Meet, and Zenless Zone Zero quite well without major frame drops. Battery life is awesome and holds up nicely during gaming too. The camera is okay not the best, but decent enough for everyday use. Sound quality is also fine, loud and clear enough for gaming and videos. In the box, you get an adapter and a really good quality case, which is a nice bonus, and it even comes with a pre applied screen guard. Overall, it’s a great phone, especially for smooth performance and gaming.

The smartphone market in 2026 is no longer about just raw megapixels or clock speeds; it’s about how seamlessly a device integrates into your life through intelligence. The Nova Ultra 7 enters the fray not just as a piece of hardware, but as a dedicated AI companion. After two weeks of heavy use, here is our deep dive.

The move to a 6,500mAh Silicon-Carbon battery is a game changer. Despite the slim profile, the Ultra 7 easily lasted two full days on a single charge.

Charging: 120W wired charging gets you from 0 to 100% in just 19 minutes.
